<< evalc Core execstr >>

evalin

Evaluate Nelson code in string in an specified scope.

Syntax

evalin(scope, str)
[r1, ... rn] = evalin(scope, str)

Input argument

scope

a string: 'base' or 'caller'.

str

a string: Nelson instruction to execute

Output argument

[r1, ... rn]

results: output variables

Description

eval executes Nelson instructions given in a string in 'base' or 'caller' scope.

Example

R = evalin('base', 'evalin(''caller'',''pi'')')

See also

eval, acquirevar, execstr, evalc.

History

Version Description
1.0.0 initial version

Author

Allan CORNET
